factoid: The staff captain said "I did not expect this of you."
The staff captain said "You don’t wish to apologize."
The staff captain said "It’s not only to him but to the whole regiment—you’re to blame all round."
The staff captain said "You ought to have thought the matter over and taken advice."
The staff captain said "You went and blurted it all straight out before the officers."
The staff captain asked "What was the colonel to do?"
The staff captain asked "Have the officer tried and disgraced the whole regiment?"
The staff captain asked "Disgrace the whole regiment because of one scoundrel?"
The staff captain asked "Is that how you look at it?"
The staff captain said "We don’t see it like that."
Bogdánich told the staff captain that the staff captain was saying what was not true.
The staff captain said "It’s not pleasant, but what’s to be done, my dear fellow?"
The staff captain said "You landed yourself in it."
The staff captain said "Now, when one wants to smooth the thing over, some conceit prevents your apologizing, and you wish to make the whole affair public."
The staff captain said "You are offended at being put on duty a bit."
The staff captain said "Why not apologize to an old and honorable officer?"
The staff captain said "Whatever Bogdánich may be, anyway he is an honorable and brave old colonel."
The staff captain said "You’re quick at taking offense, but you don’t mind disgracing the whole regiment."
The staff captain’s voice trembled.

The staff captain said "You have been in the regiment next to no time, my lad, you’re here today and tomorrow you’ll be appointed adjutant somewhere and can snap your fingers when it is said ‘There are thieves among the Pávlograd officers!’"
The staff captain said "But it’s not all the same to us!"
The staff captain said "Am I not right, Denísov?"
The staff captain said "It’s not the same!"
Denísov looked at Rostóv with glittering black eyes.
The staff captain said "You value your own pride and don’t wish to apologize."
The staff captain said "We old fellows, who have grown up in and, God willing, are going to die in the regiment, we prize the honor of the regiment, and Bogdánich knows it."
The staff captain said "Oh, we do prize it, old fellow!"
The staff captain said "All this is not right, it’s not right!"
The staff captain said "You may take offense or not but I always stick to mother truth."
The staff captain said "It’s not right!"
The staff captain rose and turned away from Rostóv.
Denísov shouted "That’s true, devil take it!"
Denísov shouted "Now then, Wostóv, now then!"
Rostóv looked first at one officer and then at the other.
Rostóv said "No, gentlemen, no... you mustn’t think... I quite understand."

Rostóv said "You’re wrong to think that of me... I... for me... for the honor of the regiment I’d... Ah well, I’ll show that in action, and for me the honor of the flag... Well, never mind, it’s true I’m to blame, to blame all round."
Rostóv said "Well, what else do you want?"
The staff captain said "Come, that’s right, Count!"
The staff captain clapped Rostóv on the shoulder.
Denísov shouted "He’s a fine fellow."
The staff captain said "That’s better, Count."
The staff captain said "Go and apologize, your excellency."
The staff captain said "Yes, go!"
Rostóv said "Gentlemen, I’ll do anything. No one shall hear a word from me."
Rostóv said "but I can’t apologize, by God I can’t, do what you will! How can I go and apologize like a little boy asking forgiveness?"
Denísov laughed.
Kírsten said "It’ll be worse for you. Bogdánich is vindictive and you’ll pay for your obstinacy."
Kírsten said "No, on my word it’s not obstinacy! I can’t describe the feeling. I can’t..."
The staff captain said "Well, it’s as you like."
The staff captain asked "And what has become of that scoundrel?"
Denísov muttered "He has weported himself sick, he’s to be stwuck off the list tomorrow."
The staff captain said "It is an illness, there’s no other way of explaining it."
Bogdánich is vindictive.
Bogdánich is an honorable and brave old colonel.
Bogdánich knows that the regiment prizes honor.
Denísov remained silent.
